ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Genomic editing
How to present
Research and communication skills
I learned new research techniques and refined my own research interests.
Research about the Pyle lab. Learn how to make a good presentation for the rotation talk.
I learned a lot of new techniques during my first rotation.
Basic research principles and techniques.
Laboratory skills and scientific insights
I learned how to analysis the Hi-C data.
I learned new lab techniques, such as ddPCR, HPLC, and MALDI Mass Spec.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The period is too short for a real research progress and too long for getting the taste of the lab.
Weakness: the time
Wonderful experience
The course is allowed us to learn what it's like to be in the lab that I'm interested.
The rotation talk and peer feedback are very helpful.
Great
Strength: I can really engage into the researches and learn things. The rotation talk also give us a chance to summary the work and practice how to deliver a presentation,
I liked that I got to experience the lab culture and techniques used in the lab before committing to a thesis lab; however, the rotation felt a bit short.

A strentgh is looking for external resources to guide my thoughts and understanding of a topic. A weakness was trying to understand a topic that I am not fmailiar with and write an assignment on the topic with very little content given during lecture to guide my external searches.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes
Yes
Yes. The opportunity to visit new labs, experience new research perspectives, and learn new techniques is invaluable for refining research interests and develop professional connections.
Yes
Yes
Yes, I think rotations are a great way to help narrow down what lab you want to work in.
Yes. I think the course is challenging and will increase knowledge actively. However, there is more to improve.
